Direzione o partecipazione a comitati ed.content: Member of the editorial board of the international journal SYSTEM https://www.journals.elsevier.com/system/editorial-board
Regular reviewer for the CALL journal, Language Learning & Technology, ReCALL and occasional reviewer for other journals.

Organizzazione o partecipazione come rel.content: INVITED SPEAKER at Web 2.0 and Language Learning: Definable Boundaries? Modern Languages Conference, University of Limerick: "This comment was removed": The challenges of harnessing Web 2.0 for language and intercultural learning.

Panelist in plenary session with Mirjam Hauck, Ed Gragaert and Catharine Bufalino at 4th COIL Conference: Moving from Me to We: Breaking Boundaries and Building Bridges with Globally Networked Learning Partnerships. SUNY Global Center, New York: "The Expanding Globally Networked Landscape: Soliya, iEARN and INTENT".
Symposium with Sarah Guth, Mirjam Hauck, Sake Jager, Gosia Kurek. EUROCALL , Gothenberg, Sweden: "Telecollaboration: Where we are and where we are headed."
Presentation: Promoting internationalization through Telecollaboration. Presentation at CERCLES, LSE London.
INVITED SPEAKER at the conference Knowledge Triangle: New formulas for science presentation, University of Pisa, Italy.
Presentation: CALLing on Ethiopia. WorldCALL, University of Ullster. "Integrating Telecollaborative Networks into Higher Education".

Co-Organisation of International Interdisciplinary Winter School: Times and Spaces of Globalization. Europe in a Global Context Speakers: Annabelle Sreberny (SOAS, London, UK), Flavia Monceri (Università del Molise), Jan Aart Scholte - Warwick University (UK), Lynn Mario de Sousa (Universidade de Sao Paulo, Brazil), Uday Mehta (CUNY, USA), Esmè Cartens and Casper van der Heijden (Sharing Perspectives Foundation, NL).
Presentation: More than language: Mediating conflict and constructing dialogue online. Lingue, linguaggi e politica, University of Padova.
Presentation: Identity and participation in telecollaboration. LLAS Elearning symposium, University of Southampton.
INVITED SPEAKER at Open University, Milton Keynes, UK. 'Exploring identity and participation in online interaction through MCA'.

Co-Organisation of School for all Seasons Times and Spaces of Globalization. Illusions of Democracy. (Speakers from international institutions: Gilbert Achars, Micheal Bailey, Veronica Barassi, Somnath Batabyal, Bart Cammaerts, Lynn Mario de Sousa, Natalie Fenton, Marianne Franklin, Gaia Giuliani, Sophia Kaitatzi, Gholam Khiabani, Arne Hintz, Dina Matar, Stefania Milan, Matti Pohionen, Marina Prentoulis, Eugenia Sapiera, Jan Scholte, Murali Shanmugavelan, Gareth Stanton). London (SOAS) 18-22 May 2015.

INVITED SPEAKER at conference. Conceptualizing language in EMI: Studies from international universities in Europe and Asia. University of Southampton. 'Italian lecturers’ perspectives on EMI: A transdisciplinary case study'.

INVITED SPEAKER at EMI Oxford Centre for Research and Development in English Medium Instruction. "The disruptive potential of EMI: A case study from Italy". http://www.education.ox.ac.uk/crdemi-oxford/emi-research/

ORGANIZER of the EUROCALL (European Association of Computer Assisted Language Learning) Annual conference. Theme of the conference was Critical CALL. Over 300 registered participants at the conference and 200 papers presented. See conference proceedings https://research-publishing.net/content. php?doi=10.14705/rpnet.2015.978190841629 2

INVITED KEYNOTE SPEAKER in panel discussion on ‘open communities and networks’ at the EM&M Italia conference, Genova, 9-11 September 2015.Interaction, collaboration and power issues in open communities and education networks. http://www.ememitalia.org/
INVITED SPEAKER and discussant at ViLs2 conference, Orebro University, Sweden. "Exploring identity and participation in online intercultural exchange".

Organisation of International Interdisciplinary Winter School Times and Spaces of Globalization. Necessary Translations for Global Understanding. Speakers: Annabelle Sreberny (SOAS, UK), Mohammad Omar (Soliya, Search for Common Ground, Tunisia), Flavia Monceri (Università del Molise, Italy), Jan Aart Scholte (Gothenburg University, SW), Lynn Mario de Sousa (Universidade de Sao Paulo, Brazil), Mona Baker (University of Manchester), Marc Raboy (McGill University, Canada), Francesca Musiani (CNRS, France), Elena Pavan (Scuola Normale Superiore, Italy), Banu Bargu (The new School for Social research, US), Malgorzata Winiarska (Jagiellonian University, Poland).

Presentation (with Melinda Dooly) at the 2nd International Conference on Telecollaboration in Higher Education, Trinity College, Dublin. "Space, time and mode in multimodal data: challenges for transcription and representation"

INVITED SPEAKER (with Katherine Ackerley) at English-Medium Instruction in Higher Education Syposium, Università Cattolica, Milan, Italy. “Ho dovuto portarmi dietro il vecchio corso in italiano e spogliarmi di lui”: Supporting lecturers in EMI.

Invited workshop at 23rd Annual ICC Conference, Mainz, Germany. "English as a medium of instruction: Chances, challenges and implications". http://www.icc-languages.eu/conferences/ 23rd-icc-annual-conference-mainz/confere nce-programme

Presentation (with Fiona Dalziel) at The Multilingual University - Seminar 6: The linguistic landscape in higher education in English-dominant and EMI settings: Future directions Institute of Education: "From prohibition to choice: Exploring language practices in an Italian university".
INVITED KEYNOTE SPEAKER at Jornadas CRUE, Universitat Jaume I, Castellon, Spain. "The promises and challenges of EMI".

Conference presentation: English Languaging Workshops: An attempt to subvert power dynamics. IALIC 2016 annual conference of the International Association for Languages and Intercultural Communication, with the theme: ‘Bridging across languages and cultures in everyday lives: New roles for changing scenarios’.Universitat Autònoma de Barcelona.

Member of organizing Committee. IALIC 2016 annual conference of the International Association for Languages and Intercultural Communication, with the theme: ‘Bridging across languages and cultures in everyday lives: New roles for changing scenarios’.Universitat Autònoma de Barcelona.

INVITED SPEAKER in Round table session: The future of Virtual Exchange. The first European Conference on Collaborative Online International Learning (COIL), The Hague University of Applied Sciences, NL.

Presentation: A Cross-country Comparison of Lecturers’ Beliefs and Experiences of the International Classroom and EMI. IV Convegno dell’associazione Didattica delle Lingue e la Linguistica Educativa (DILLE) Università Ca’ Foscari, Venezia.

Organisation of International Interdisciplinary Winter School Times and Spaces of Globalization. Boundaries, borders and walls: What of universality? Speakers: Annabelle Sreberny (SOAS, UK), Flavia Monceri (Università del Molise, Italy), Jan Aart Scholte (Gothenburg University, SW), Lynn Mario de Sousa (Universidade de Sao Paulo, Brazil), Francesca Musiani (CNRS, France), Elena Pavan (Scuola Normale Superiore, Italy), Hagar Kotef (SOAS, UK), Gaia Giuliani (CES -University of Coimbra, InteRGRace), Uday Mehta (CUNY, US)

Responsabilita' di studi e ricerche scie.content: Data analysis. This study entails the analysis of the intercultural awareness of learners in the second cohort of the SUNY COIL Center’s participants in the Stevens Initiative, Spring 2017. The Research Foundation of State University of New York

Specifiche esperienze professionali cara.content: Member of the EUROCALL Executive Committee (European Association for Computer Assisted Language Learning)
Representative for Padova University in the Coimbra Group E-Learning Task Force.

Collaboration with the Sharing Perspective Foundation (The Netherlands) in the organization and delivery of online educational materials, in the context of European projects on ‘Rethinking citizenship’ and ‘Perspectives on the Euro(pean) Crisis’, Refuge/es. Just become member of the Board of Trustees

Vice-president of the Innovation Education Working Group of the international network of universities, Coimbra Group. This position involves organization of seminars, writing reports on activity, position papers and research on innovation in education.

Formale attribuzione di incarichi di ins.content: Critical Discourse Analysis – Series of seminars at the Faculty of Political Science, Universidad Rafael Landivar, Guatemala, July 2010 (through Erasmus Mundus project)
E-learning and English Language Teaching. Tutor and assessor of module on MA in ELT run by the British Council and University of Southampton.

Direzione o partecipazione alle attivit\.content: Collaborazione con il gruppo di ricerca che ha partecipato al programma su fondi PRIN: “ENGLISHMULTIWEB: Lingua inglese e multimedia su web per ricerca, apprendimento, accertamento, traduzione e mobilità universitaria” (Resp. Scient. dell'Unità di Ricerca: Carol Elaine TAYLOR; Coord. Scient. del Programma di Ricerca: Christopher John TAYLOR, Univ. di Trieste; titolo del Programma di Ricerca: eColingua: e-corpora negli studi linguistici e multimodali, nella traduzione, nell'apprendimento e nelle verifiche on-line delle lingue.

Member of the EUROCALL Executive Committee (European Association for Computer Assisted Language Learning). The European Association has over 200 members, a peer-reviewed journal ReCALL published by Cambridge University Press, and an annual conference usually attracting over 250 delegates. Francesca Helm organized the 2015 annual conference at the University of Padova.

Associate member of the research group GREIP - Research group on plurilingual interaction and teaching, Universitat Autònoma de Barcelona. http://grupsderecerca.uab.cat/greip/en/content/associate-members

Cooperation with the University of Padova research fund (PRAT, Padovani member of research team coordinated by Giorgia Nesti). Topic: La dimensione di genere nella governance delle smart cities: uno proposta di valutazione orientata al gender mainstreaming.

Lead researcher in the HELPP (Higher Education Language Policies and Practices, see website http://www.helpp.it/) group which was founded in 2015 after the collaboration of the founding members in the LEAP project (Learning English for Academic Purposes) financed by the International Relations office of the University of Padova regarding professional development of lecturers for English-medium Instruction. The research group focuses on language policies and practices in higher education, currently focusing on English-medium instruction and internationalisation. The group collaborates with international academics including Bob Wilkinson (University of Maastricht), Ernesto Macaro (Director of the Oxford EMI Centre), Karen Lauridsen (Aarhus University), Melinda Dooly (Universitat Autonoma de Barcelona).

Participant researcher in the KONECT project (Knowledge for Network-based Education, Cognition & Teaching). Funded by Ministry of Science and Innovation: Proyectos I+D del Programa Estatal de Fomento de la Investigación Científica y Técnica de Excelencia (EDU2013-43932-P); 2014-2018. Taking a research- action approach, this project proposes specific measures for improving primary and middle-school students’ communicative and academic skills in order to better ensure their responsible participation in our knowledge society.

Founding member of UNICollaboration - a group of researchers and educators involved in telecollaboration and virtual exchange (http://www.unicollaboration.org/). The group was founded after the collaboration of many of the members in the INTENT project, and is involved in research on telecollaboration, the launch of a new journal and a bi-annual international conference, the first of which will be held in Krakow in May 2018 (http://www.unicollaboration.org/index.p hp/unicollaboration-conference-krakow-po land-2018/).

Responsabilita' scientifica per progetti.content: Coordinator for University of Padova in the INTENT (Integrating Telecollaborative Networks into University Foreign Language Education. Erasmus Multilateral Project funded by the European Cmmission. Project Reference: 517622-LLP-1-2011-1-ES-ERASMUS-ESMO Total funding 254631,00 Euros. Funding for Padova 25932,00 Euros. The project was identified by the European as a Success Story and selected as an example of Good Practice (see attached file).

Co-ordinator and researcher for University of Padova in “EVALUATE – Evaluating and Upscaling Telecollaborative Teacher Education” . This project was funded by Erasmus+ - KA3 - European policy experimentations in the fields of Education, Training and Youth led by high-level public authorities - call EACEA/34/2015. Total funding 453.377,19 ; Funding for Padova 55.267,73
